original_problem_description: A food processing plant aims to minimize waste in its operations. Each process has a different waste factor and cost. The goal is to adjust the processes to minimize total waste.

questions.vague_problem_description: A food processing plant aims to adjust its operations. Each process has a different waste factor and cost.
questions.clarifying_question: What is the specific goal of adjusting the operations – is it to minimize waste, minimize cost, or optimize a combination of both?

questions.vague_problem_description: A food processing plant aims to minimize waste in its operations. Each process has a different factor and cost associated with it.
questions.clarifying_question: What is the 'factor' mentioned here? Is it the waste factor, production rate, or some other metric?

questions.vague_problem_description: A food processing plant aims to minimize waste. The goal is to adjust the processes accordingly.
questions.clarifying_question: What kind of adjustments can be made to the processes? Are there any constraints on the production levels or changes in the process settings?
